CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 2, 1957, pg. 3, reads: "'Pray for Me' - Mr. and Mrs. Richard J. Clinton of 529 Murtland Ave., Homewood, ask for blood donors and your prayers for their three-year-old daughter, Clayce, who is fighting bravely will all of the spirit and courage which her frail body can muster against the ravages of blood cancer in West Penn Hospital. She was been hospitalized since the day after Christmas. - Harris Photo."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper March 23, 1957, pg. 2, reads: "Leukemia Victim Dies - Three-year-old Clayce Clinton of 529 N. Murtland Ave., Homewood, was buried Wednesday after becoming a victim of leukemia of the blood. She is pictured here with her mother, Mrs. Richard J. Clinton, at West Penn Hospital when an appeal was made for blood donors in an attempt to save her life. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Clayce Clinton in hospital bed with her mother Mrs. Clinton fixing her hair, father Richard J. Clinton, and dolls on headboard in background, in West Penn Hospital
